intro: Oroya neoperuviana var. ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty oroya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish-brown stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. This species is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapted to thrive in high-altitude conditions.
